pullRequest.title: Enforce stability of Metric names
pullRequest.bodyText:
Best-effort enforcement for stabilizing the metric names by extracting all textual part of the metric descriptor into a class containing the metrics constants and by making the name of the @Probe annotation mandatory. It's best-effort in the way that one can still write metric names etc as inline strings. The point is having a single place for listing metrics constants that are expected not to change between patch releases. Also, it makes looking up for metric names quicker.
Implements #16266
EE PR: hazelcast/hazelcast-enterprise#3495

commit.message: Add constants for metric descriptor fields except metric names
Extract metric names into a file containing constants

beforeCommit.message: Extract metric names into a file containing constants

afterCommit.message: Extract metric names into a file containing constants

nodes.bodyText:
Just wondering - instead of having separate CACHE_DISCRIMINATOR_NAME, EXECUTOR_DISCRIMINATOR_NAME, MAP_DISCRIMINATOR_NAME, GENERAL_DISCRIMINATOR_NAME, wouldn't it be better to have just one - DISCRIMINATOR_NAME? The same maybe for other discriminators.
But this is minor and probably just a mater of taste.

+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.

+
+package com.hazelcast.internal.metrics;
+
+/**
+ * Class holding constants for metric names, prefixes, discriminators etc.
+ * <p/>
+ *
+ * IMPORTANT NOTE:
+ * The constants in this file are meant to be stable and can be changed
+ * between minor releases only if at all. Changing any of the constants
+ * in this class might break Management Center or any metrics consumer
+ * code.
+ */
+public final class MetricDescriptorConstants {
+
+    // ===[CACHE]=======================================================
+    public static final String CACHE_PREFIX = "cache";
+    public static final String CACHE_DISCRIMINATOR_NAME = "name";

nodes.bodyText:

nodes.bodyText: Don't we use COUNT by the default? Same question for another probe in this class.
How about ENUM unit here?
How about BOOLEAN unit here?
How about MS unit here and in other time related probes in this class?

In other similar probe names we use Ms or Time suffixes. Shouldn't we rename this one and other time probes in this class, until it's not too late?
BTW I didn't find any usages for them in MC, so the rename shouldn't break MC at least.
How about PERCENT unit here?
Don't we use COUNT unit by default? Same question for the next probe here.
Don't we use COUNT by default? Same question for other count probes here.
Do we need MS unit here? The same question for other time probes in this class.
Does this probe stand for time? If yes, how about MS unit here?
How about specifying BYTES unit here and below?
